cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 765 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico; forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest and approach the Texas-Louisiana border.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron-Sabine Pass, LA (just south-southwest of Lake Charles)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Bolivar, TX, to west of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for this portion of the coast at the moment
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through south-central Louisiana, including Calcasieu and Vermilion Bays
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are very likely (83% chance) with a 56% chance of 50-kt winds and roughly a 28% chance of hurricane-force winds at Lake Charles late Wednesday night into Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC guidance calls for 7–11 ft of inundation possible from High Island, TX, to Morgan City, LA, which includes Calcasieu Lake adjacent to the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches expected, leading to flash and urban flooding around the port and its access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves in the ship channel, dangerous rip currents, possible tornadoes in rainbands, debris-clogged waterways, and temporary port closure due to flooding.
